data.title: VES - Halon Entertainment
data.text:
HALON ENTERTAINMENT

Halon Entertainment is a premiere game cinematic, visualization, and virtual production studio comprised of seasoned visualization supervisors, artists, and creatives committed to the advancement of storytelling and real-time virtual production.

Since 2003, Halon has collaborated with some of Hollywood’s most celebrated filmmakers behind films and video games such as The Batman, John Wick 4, Fortnite, Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom, Star Wars, and Borderlands.

CONCEPT • VISUALIZATION • VIRTUAL PRODUCTION • VAD • VIRTUAL LOCATION SCOUTING • VIRTUAL CAMERA• CREATIVE DEVELOPMENT• MOTION CAPTURE • ANIMATION • OPTOMIZATION FOR LED

Real-time technology

Halon uses real-time technology to enhance efficiency and flexibility. Through quick iterations, it streamlines production, saves time and resources, and boosts creativity. It also allows for seamless integration with virtual production.

THE NEW FRONTIER: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

Halon is leveraging artificial intelligence to enhance our tools and pipelines, with the aim of improving productivity, speed, and cost-effectiveness for our clients. Contact us now to learn more about our innovative experiments.

PREVIS

“There is no better way to breakdown complex Scenes into achievable Shots and impactful Sequences than with PreVisualization.”

THE BATMAN

PREVIS & TECHVIS

For The Batman, Halon provided previs and techvis to help bring Matt Reeves’ cinematic vision to life.

The previs supplies rapid iteration of creative exploration for the scenes, and the techvis is then used to breakdown the physical parameters of the previs to to ensure the shots in the sequence are physically attainable.

Some of the key sequences included the Penguin Batmobile chase, Mitchell’s Funeral, and the Bat Glider sequence, the latter of which involved charting out the distance, arc, and key angles of Batman’s descent in order to deliver the most realistic effects possible.

THE HUNGER GAMES: THE BALLAD OF SONGBIRDS AND SNAKES

PREVIS, TECHVIS & POSTVIS

Halon contributed Previs and Techvis services to assist in bringing the fifth installment of the Hunger Games series to the big screen.

Working closely with director Francis Lawrence and VFX supervisor Adrien Dewet, Halon played a key role in visualizing and technically solving challenges for the snake sequence, the arena’s destruction, and the drone attack. Their work significantly informed the principal photography and VFX production.

TECHVIS

“TECHVIS CAN BREAK DOWN PREVIS INTO PRACTICAL AND ACHIEVABLE PLANS, SHOWING KEY TECHNICAL INFORMATION THAT ARE ESSENTIAL FOR PRINCIPLE PHOTOGRAPHY.”

JOHN WICK CHAPTER 4

TECHVIS

Our Techvis team will provide you with a visual guide to aid shot setup. Our on-set experience and technical

insight will inform you of real-world speeds, angles and distances, ensuring that the shots you want are attainable and safe.

Working closely with your production, our technical artists break shots down to their essentials, delivering detailed animated overviews and printables to give your team facts, figures, and foresight.

POSTVIS

“POSTVIS AIDS IN THE EDIT OF YOUR FILM BY FILLING IN THE GAPS AND HELPS DETERMINE WHAT VFX WORK IS REQUIRED, ENSURING NO COSTLY VFX WORK ENDS UP ON THE CUTTING ROOM FLOOR”

COCAINE BEAR

POSTVIS

For Elizabeth Banks’ horror comedy Cocaine Bear, Halon was brought on to create postvis for the majority of shots featuring Cokey the bear.

Supervisor Brad Alexander worked onsite for five months in the production office, enabling a more efficient and collaborative fine cutting of the film before the final effects were completed.

THE SUICIDE SQUAD

POSTVIS

For The Suicide Squad, Halon was brought on to add King Shark and Rat Catcher’s rats to the footage, along with general clean up of distracting elements and to add any additional effects and specialty weapons as needed.

This allowed for a more immersive pre-final VFX edit of the film which communicated James Gunn’s spectacular vision to the Finals VFX Vendors with frame-accurate clarity.

VIRTUAL PRODUCTION

HALON PROVIDES AN INTEGRATED SUITE OF VIRTUAL PRODUCTION SERVICES, ALLOWING US TO CREATE PHOTOREALISTIC SET EXTENSIONS FOR LED WALLS AND SHOOT SCENES THROUGH VIRTUAL CAMERAS.

DISNEY’S PINOCCHIO

PREVIS, VIRTUAL CAMERA, TECHVIS, POSTVIS

When it came time for Robert Zemeckis to reimagine Disney’s beloved classic, Halon was brought on to provide previs, techvis, and postvis, touching almost every scene in the film.

Halon also was asked to create a custom virtual camera system which was employed on a virtual stage to give Zemeckis full creative freedom to bring his vision to life.

VIRTUAL ART DEPARTMENT

When it came time for Robert Zemeckis to reimagine Disney’s beloved classic, halon was brought on to perform Previs, Techvis, and Postvis duties, touching almost every scene in the film.

Halon also was asked to create a custom virtual camera system, that was employed on a Virtual Stage, to give Zemeckis full creative freedom to bring his vision to life.

TECHVIS FOR LED WALLS

Halon’s visualization and virtual production team excels at creating and optimizing content tailored for LED Walls.

Halon builds custom tools that enable us to provide technical visualizations, effectively distinguishing between physical and digital SET ELEMENTS.

CONTACT US

To inquire about our services or request information, you can email sales@halon.com or fill out the form below and we will get back to you.
